qas.question: Other than being race and gender based, what did believers in affirmative action also feel that the system discriminated against?
Which organization believed in the class based argument?
What group of people did the AAPF claim affirmative action created?
What does the AAPF believe the foundation for the class based argument is?

answers.text: non-poor minorities do not experience racial and gender based discrimination

qas.question: What does the AAPF believe the goal of affirmative action should be?

answers.text: to address race-based obstacles that block the path to success

qas.question: Other than being race and gender based, what did believers in affirmative action also feel that the system did not discriminate against
Which organization believed in the non-class based argument?
What group of people did the AAPF claim affirmative action did not create?

plausible_answers.text: non-poor minorities do not experience racial and gender based discrimination

qas.question: What does the AAPF believe the foundation for the class based agreement is?

plausible_answers.text: to address race-based obstacles that block the path to success of countless people of color of all classes

qas.question: What does the AAPF believe the goal of non-affirmative action should be?

context: Proponents of affirmative action argue that by nature the system is not only race based, but also <a0_0><b5_0>class<b5_0/><a0_0/> and gender based. To eliminate two of its key components would undermine the purpose of the entire system. The <a1_0><b6_0>African American Policy<b6_0/> Forum<a1_0/> believes that the class based argument is based on the idea that <a3_0><b8_0>non-poor minorities do not experience racial and gender based discrimination<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The AAPF believes that "Race-conscious affirmative action remains necessary <a4_0><b9_0>to address race-based obstacles that block the path to success<a4_0/> of countless people of color of all classes<b9_0/>". The groups goes on to say that affirmative action is responsible for creating the <a2_0><b7_0>African American middle class<b7_0/><a2_0/>, so it does not make sense to say that the system only benefits the middle and upper classes.
